result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone R Hampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.

Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain and maintain employment.
Obtain a GED or HSED.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  No use of weapons of any kind.
No contact with the victim, Jennifer P.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With release privileges for employment, treatment, and school purposes only - STAYED until 05-14-2015 at 12:00 PM.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone R Hampton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrone R Hampton in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 48 MONTHS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 24 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS. 
Credit given for 3 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 90 DAYS "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for employment, treatment, and school purposes only - STAYED until 05-14-2015 at 12:00 PM.
* No contact with the victim, Jennifer P.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain and maintain employment.
* Obtain a GED or HSED.
* No use of weapons of any kind.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
* The conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Sentencing Referral Form.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Tyrone R Hampton in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Tyrone R Hampton in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense withdraws the motion for bail review.
 Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-07-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

15RM015674  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-24-15

Defendant Tyrone R Hampton in court with Vincent Guimont for attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Tyrone R Hampton in custody. Ron Dague for Dague for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jennifer P. dob 5/4/76; Trevion S. dob 12/31/98; Loren A. dob 3/31/96

Defendant Tyrone R Hampton in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Tyrone R Hampton in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
